This chunk is part of a larger document that describes the creation of a graphical user interface (GUI) using Tkinter and Panda3D for a motion recording and playback system. The code defines various UI elements such as menus, combo boxes, radio buttons, and other widgets to allow users to interact with node paths, select recording modes, and manage application settings. This specific chunk focuses on configuring the UI components related to node path selection and defining radio buttons for different recording types ('New Curve' and 'Refine'), which are essential for managing motion data within the system.

self.nodePathMenuEntry = (
            self.nodePathMenu.component('entryfield_entry'))
        self.nodePathMenuBG = (
            self.nodePathMenuEntry.configure('background')[3])
        self.nodePathMenu.pack(side = tk.LEFT, fill = tk.X, expand = 1)
        self.bind(self.nodePathMenu,
                  'Select active node path used for recording and playback')
        # Recording type
        self.recordingType = tk.StringVar()
        self.recordingType.set('New Curve')
        widget = self.createRadiobutton(
            frame, 'left',
            'Recording', 'New Curve',
            ('Next record session records a new path'),
            self.recordingType, 'New Curve', expand = 0)
        widget = self.createRadiobutton(
            frame, 'left',
            'Recording', 'Refine',
            ('Next record session refines existing path'),
